history.introduction: The origins of Arulmigu Murugar Kovil date back over a thousand years. According to local legend, the temple was founded by a great saint who had a vision of Lord Muruga appearing as a youthful warrior.
history.architecture: The temple features breathtaking Dravidian architecture, with intricately carved pillars and a majestic Rajagopuram (main tower) that reaches towards the sky.
history.significance: Lord Muruga here is worshipped in his form as 'Sivasubramanya', the master of all knowledge and the protector of the righteous.

festivals.title: Thaipusam
festivals.description: Grand celebration with Kavadi Aatam and special poojas.

festivals.title: Skanda Shashti
festivals.description: Celebrating the victory over Soorapadman with Soorasamharam.
